data.text: He that loves instruction loves sense,
He that has found favor with the Lord is made better;
A man shall not prosper by wickedness;
A virtuous woman is a crown to her husband;
The thoughts of the righteous are true judgments;
The words of ungodly men are crafty;
When the ungodly is overthrown, he vanishes away;
The mouth of an understanding man is praised by a man;
Better is a man in dishonor serving himself,
A righteous man has pity for the lives of his cattle;
He that tills his own land shall be satisfied with bread;
He that enjoys himself in banquets of wine,
The desires of the ungodly are evil;
For the sin of his lips a sinner falls into snares;
He whose looks are gentle shall be pitied,
The soul of a man shall be filled with good from the fruits of his mouth;
The ways of fools are right in their own eyes;
A fool declares his wrath the same day;
A righteous man declares the open truth;
Some wound as they speak, like swords;
True lips establish testimony;
There is deceit in the heart of him that imagines evil;
No injustice will please a just man;
Lying lips are an abomination to the Lord;
An understanding man is a throne of wisdom;
The hand of chosen men shall easily obtain rule;
A terrible word troubles the heart of a righteous man;
A just arbitrator shall be his own friend;
A deceitful man shall catch no game;
In the ways of righteousness is life;
